title: Sinkhole
summary: A sinkhole is a depression or hole in the ground caused by some form of collapse of the surface layer. The term is sometimes used to refer to doline, enclosed depressions that are in locally also known as vrtaƒçe and shakeholes, and to openings where surface water enters into underground passages known as ponor, swallow hole or swallet.[1][2][3][4] A cenote is a type of sinkhole that exposes groundwater underneath.[4] A sink or stream sink are more general terms for sites that drain surface water, possibly by infiltration into sediment or crumbled rock.[2]
